meanings.definition: A person who strips off the skin or outer covering of something.
meanings.sent1: The skilled flayers quickly removed the bark from the tree trunk.
meanings.sent2: The flayers at the tannery expertly peeled the hides from the animals.
meanings.sent3: The flayers at the fruit market were so fast, they could peel an apple in seconds!
meanings.sent4: She was a flayer of emotions, always revealing the raw truth beneath the surface.
meanings.sent5: The image of the flayers at work was both fascinating and unsettling.

meanings.definition: A tool or device used for removing the skin or outer covering of something.
meanings.sent1: The sharp flayers made the task of peeling vegetables much easier.
meanings.sent2: She used the metal flayers to carefully strip the paint off the old furniture.
meanings.sent3: The kitchen flayers were her favorite gadgets, making cooking prep a breeze.
meanings.sent4: The flayers of time slowly revealed the history hidden beneath the layers.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the flayers scraping against the wood echoed in the workshop.
